member.name: T:ACMESharp.AcmeAccount
member.summary: Represents the details of a registered ACME Account with a specific ACME CA.

member.name: P:ACMESharp.AcmeAccount.Kid
member.summary: This is the Key Identifier used in most messages sent to the ACME CA after the initial Account registration. It references the public key that was registered with the Account in the JWS-signed Account create message.
member.remarks:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-6.2 https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.3
The KID is returned as a Location header in the Account creation response.

member.name: P:ACMESharp.AcmeAccount.Id
member.summary: CA-assigned unique identifier for the Account.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Authorizations.Dns01ChallengeValidationDetails
member.summary: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-8.4

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Authorizations.Http01ChallengeValidationDetails
member.summary: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-8.3

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Crypto.Base64Tool
member.summary: Collection of convenient crypto operations working with URL-safe Base64 encoding.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.Base64Tool.UrlEncode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: URL-safe Base64 encoding as prescribed in RFC 7515 Appendix C.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.Base64Tool.UrlEncode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: URL-safe Base64 encoding as prescribed in RFC 7515 Appendix C.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.Base64Tool.UrlDecode(System.String)
member.summary: URL-safe Base64 decoding as prescribed in RFC 7515 Appendix C.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Crypto.CryptoHelper
member.summary:
For the most compatibility with LE, see: https://letsencrypt.org/docs/integration-guide/#supported-key-algorithms We should support: * RSA Keys (2048-4096 bits) * ECDSA Keys (P-256, P-384)
Thats' for both account keys and cert keys.

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Crypto.CryptoHelper.Base64
member.summary: Returns a singleton instance of cryptographic tool for URL-safe Base64 encoding.

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Crypto.CryptoHelper.Rsa
member.summary: Returns a singleton instance of cryptographic tool for working with RSA keys and algorithms.

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Crypto.CryptoHelper.Ec
member.summary: Returns a singleton instance of cryptographic tool for working with EC keys and algorithms.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Crypto.EcTool
member.summary: Collection of convenient crypto operations working with Elliptic Curve keys and algorithms.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.Impl.ESJwsSigner
member.summary: JWS Signing tool implements ES-family of algorithms as per http://self-issued.info/docs/draft-ietf-jose-json-web-algorithms-00.html#SigAlgTable

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.Impl.ESJwsSigner.CurveName
member.summary: As per: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7518#section-6.2.1.1

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.Impl.RSJwsSigner
member.summary: JWS Signing tool implements RS-family of algorithms as per http://self-issued.info/docs/draft-ietf-jose-json-web-algorithms-00.html#SigAlgTable

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.AlgorithmIdentifier
member.summary: Returns the Algorithm Identifier used by ACMESharp.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.IsValidIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Verifies, that the current instance is able to handel the ACMESharp Algorithm Identifier
member.returns: True, if the instance is able to handle the identifier, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.SignInternal(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Does the actual signing of the input.
member.param: The input bytes to be signed.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.ExportPublicJwk
member.summary: Exports the public JWK in canoncial form as defined in RFC.
member.returns: An object containing the canical form of the public JWK

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.ExportInternal
member.summary: Exports everything neccessary, to restore the algorithms keys and other needed values. This serializes the export to string.
member.returns: String serialized export of algorithm values, like public/private keys.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.ImportInternal(System.String)
member.summary: Imports the algorithm settings from its string serialized form.
member.param: The string serialized form generated via ExportInternal()

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.JwsAlg
member.summary: The JWS-conform name of the algorithm.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.Sign(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the bytes of the inputs UTF8 representation and JWS-Signs it.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm.Sign(System.Byte[])
member.summary: JWS-Signs the input.
member.param: The byte array to be signed
member.returns: The JWS signature as byte array

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders
member.summary: Contains the well-defined headers elements as specified in RFC7515.

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.ALG
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.1. "alg" (Algorithm) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.JKU
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.2. "jku" (JWK Set URL) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.JWK
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.3. "jwk" (JSON Web Key) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.KID
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.4. "kid" (Key ID) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.X5U
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.5. "x5u" (X.509 URL) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.X5C
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.6. "x5c" (X.509 Certificate Chain) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.X5T
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.7. "x5t" (X.509 Certificate SHA-1 Thumbprint) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.X5TS56
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.8. "x5t#S256" (X.509 Certificate SHA-256 Thumbprint) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.TYP
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.9. "typ" (Type) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.CTY
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.10. "cty" (Content Type) Header Parameter

member.name: F:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHeaders.CRIT
member.summary: RFC7515 4.1.11. "crit" (Critical) Header Parameter

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHelper
member.summary: A helper class to support JSON Web Signature (JWS) operations as needed for ACME.
member.remarks: ACME only requires a subset of JWS functionality, such as only requiring support for the Flattened JWS JSON Serialization format, and so this helper class' scope and implementation of JWS is limited to those features required for ACME.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHelper.SignFlatJsonAsObject(System.Func{System.Byte[],System.Byte[]},System.String,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Computes a JSON Web Signature (JWS) according to the rules of RFC 7515 Section 5.
member.returns: Returns a signed, structured object containing the input payload.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHelper.ComputeThumbprint(ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm,System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm)
member.summary: Computes a thumbprint of the JWK using the argument Hash Algorithm as per RFC 7638, JSON Web Key (JWK) Thumbprint.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHelper.ComputeKeyAuthorization(ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm,System.String)
member.summary: Computes the ACME Key Authorization of the JSON Web Key (JWK) of an argument Signer as prescribed in the ACME specification, section 7.1.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsHelper.ComputeKeyAuthorizationDigest(ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm,System.String)
member.summary: Computes a SHA256 digest over the ACME Key Authorization as required by some of the ACME Challenge responses.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Crypto.RsaTool
member.summary: Collection of convenient crypto operations working with RSA keys and algorithms.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.HTTP.Link
member.summary: Represents a Link header value that represents the well-defined HTTP response entity header Link and more fully specified in RFC 5988 Section 5.
member.remarks: This class only implements a subset of the mechanics and nuances of the Link header field as necessary for implementing the ACME protocol.

member.name: F:ACMESharp.HTTP.Link.LinkHeaderRegex
member.summary: Regex pattern to match and extract the components of an HTTP related link header.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.HTTP.LinkCollection
member.summary: A collection of HTTP header Link objects.
member.remarks: This collection implements multiple generic-typed enumerable interfaces but for backward compatibility, the default implemenation, i.e. the IEnumerable non-generic implementation, returns a sequence of strings which are the complete, formatted Link values.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.HTTP.LinkCollection.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ACMESharp.HTTP.Link})
member.param: It's OK to provide a null value.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.HTTP.LinkCollection.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.param: It's OK to provide a null value.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Logging.NullLogger
member.summary: Implementation of the logger interface that does nothing.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Protocol.AccountDetails
member.summary: An aggregation of Account details including resource payload and ancillary, associated data.
member.remarks: This represents a superset of details that are included in responses to several ACME operations regarding an ACME Account, such as Account registration, update, key rotation and deactivation.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient
member.summary: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.Signer
member.summary: A tool that can be used to JWS-sign request messages to the target ACME server.
member.remarks: If not specified during construction, a default signing tool with a new set of keys will be constructed of type ES256 (Elliptic Curve using the P-256 curve and a SHA256 hash).

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.GetDirectoryAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves the Directory object from the target ACME CA. The Directory is used to help clients configure themselves with the right URLs for each ACME operation.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.GetTermsOfServiceAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Convenience routine to retrieve the raw bytes of the Terms of Service endpoint defined in an ACME Resource Directory meta details.
member.returns: Returns a tuple containing the content type, the filename as best can be determined by the response headers or the request URL, and the raw content bytes; typically this might resolve to a PDF file

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.GetNonceAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves a fresh nonce to be used in subsequent communication between the client and target ACME CA. The client might sometimes need to get a new nonce, e.g., on its first request to the server or if an existing nonce is no longer valid.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.CheckAccountAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Verifies that an Account exists in the target ACME CA that is associated associated with the current Account Public Key. If the check succeeds, the returned Account object will only have its Kid property populated -- all other fields will be empty.
member.remarks:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.3.1 https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.3.3
If the Account does not exist, then an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.UpdateAccountAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Updates existing Account information registered with the ACME CA.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.ChangeAccountKeyAsync(ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Rotates the current Public key that is associated with this Account by the target ACME CA with a new Public key. If successful, updates the current Account key pair registered with the client.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.DeactivateAccountAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deactivates the current Account associated with this client.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.CreateOrderAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a new Order for a Certificate which will contain one or more DNS Identifiers. The first Identifier will be treated as the primary subject of the certificate, and any optional subsequent Identifiers will be treated as Subject Alterative Name (SAN) entries.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.GetOrderDetailsAsync(System.String,ACMESharp.Protocol.OrderDetails,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves the current status and details of an existing Order.
member.remarks:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.4 https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.1.3
You can optionally pass in an existing Order details object if this is refreshing the state of an existing one, and some values that don't change, but also are not supplied in subsequent requests, such as the Order URL, will be copied over.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.GetAuthorizationDetailsAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves the details of an Authorization associated with a previously created Order. The Authorization details URL is returned as part of an Order's response.
member.remarks:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.5 https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.1.4
Use this operation to retrieve the initial details of an Authorization, such as immediately after creating a new Order, as well as to retrieve the subsequent state and progress of an Authorization, such as as after responding to an associated Challenge.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.DeactivateAuthorizationAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deactivates a specific Authorization and thereby relinquishes the authority to issue Certificates for the associated Identifier.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.GetOrderCertificateAsync(ACMESharp.Protocol.OrderDetails,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Convenience routine to retrieve the raw Certificate bytes (PEM encoded) associated with a finalized ACME Order.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.GetAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Generic fetch routine to retrieve raw bytes from a URL associated with an ACME endpoint.
member.param: The URL to fetch which may be relative to the ACME endpoint associated with this client instance
member.returns: A tuple containing the content type and the raw content bytes

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.SendAcmeAsync(System.Uri,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,System.Object,System.Net.HttpStatusCode[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.String)
member.summary: The workhorse routine for submitting HTTP requests using ACME protocol semantics and activating pre- and post-submission event hooks.
member.param: HTTP Method to use, defaults to GET
Optional request payload, will be JSON-serialized

Any HTTP response statuses that can be interpretted as successful, defaults to OK (200); other response statuses will trigger an exception; you can also skip response status checking by supplying a zero-length array value here
If true, will not expect and extract a Nonce header in the response, defaults to false
If true, will not sign the request with the associated Account key, defaults to false
If true, will include the Account's public key in the payload signature instead of the Account's key ID as prescribed with certain ACME protocol messages, defaults to false
Name of operation, will be auto-populated with calling method name if unspecified
member.returns: The returned HTTP response message, unaltered, after inspecting the response details for possible error or problem result

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.SendAcmeAsync``1(System.Uri,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,System.Object,System.Net.HttpStatusCode[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.String)
member.summary: Convenience variation of that deserializes and returns an expected type from the response content JSON.
member.remarks: All parameter semantics work as described in .

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.DecodeAccountResponseAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage,ACMESharp.Protocol.AccountDetails)
member.summary: Decodes an HTTP response, including the JSON payload and the ancillary HTTP data, into Account details.
member.param: Optionally, provide a previously decoded Account object whose elements will be re-used as necessary to populate the new result Account object; some ACME Account operations do not return the full details of an existing Account

member.name: M:ACMESharp.Protocol.AcmeProtocolClient.ComputeAcmeSigned(System.Object,System.String,ACMESharp.Crypto.JOSE.JwsAlgorithm,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes the JWS-signed ACME request body for the given message object and the current or input .

member.summary: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-6.1
member.remarks: Computed dynamically at assembly load to incorporate the full.

member.summary: The Link Header Relation key used to identify a URL to the Terms-Of-Service.

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Protocol.Messages.UpdateAccountRequest.Contact
member.summary: The list of contact URLs. Although a request to create a brand new account requires this value, when used in a request to lookup an existing account this property can be omitted.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Protocol.OrderDetails
member.summary: An aggregation of Order details including resource payload and ancillary, associated data.
member.remarks: This represents a superset of details that are included in responses to several ACME operations regarding an ACME Order, such as Order creation and finalization.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Protocol.Resources.Account
member.summary: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.1.2 https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.3

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Protocol.Resources.Authorization
member.summary: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.1.4

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Protocol.Resources.Challenge.Validated
member.summary: The time at which the server validated this challenge, encoded in the format specified in RFC 3339 [RFC3339]. This field is REQUIRED if the "status" field is "valid".

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Protocol.Resources.Challenge.ValidationRecord
member.summary: Details of successful validation.

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Protocol.Resources.Challenge.Error
member.summary: Error that occurred while the server was validating the challenge, if any, structured as a problem document [RFC7807]. Multiple errors can be indicated by using subproblems Section 6.6.1.

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Protocol.Resources.Order
member.summary: https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.1.3 https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.3

member.name: T:ACMESharp.Protocol.Resources.ProblemType
member.summary: Defines standard ACME errors.

member.name: P:ACMESharp.Protocol.Resources.ServiceDirectory.NewAuthz
member.summary: This is an optional resource that an ACME CA may support if it supports Pre-Authorizations. https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-7.4.1
